channel.title: Daniela Witten on Stat 150 at Cal Poly
channel.description: Recent content in Daniela Witten on Stat 150 at Cal Poly

item.title: Daniela Witten
item.description: “We really are facing a problem where there is to much data, but not enough tools to analyze the data.” - Daniela Witten Your writeup here: Daniela Witten is a professor at the University of Washinton. She went to school at Stanford University where she majored in Mathematics and Biological Science. A year later, she graduated and received her master’s in Statistics. Since then, she has written a statistic textbook called “An Introduction to Statistical Learning,” which has been widely used by students.

item.title: Daniela Witten (2)
item.description: “Banning p-values as a way to reduce irreproducibility in science is like banning strep tests as a way to reduce the prevalence of strep. As in, it does not work” - Daniela Witten
